55 Vita sancti Bartholomei.
SEint Bartelmev þe holie man : cam of kingues blode;
Swyþe fair man and noble he was : and glad & of swete mode.
he siwede ore louerd on eorþe here : are he deide on þe rode,
And i-sai&yogh; is priuetez : with þe oþere Apostles guode.
Þo ore louerd was to heouene i-went : he prechede of him wel faste
And wende wide in mani a lond : þe &yogh;wyle is lijf i-laste.
So þat to þe londe of .Inde : he cam þoru&yogh; godes wille;
At þe onende of þe lond : he bi-lefde wel stille.
Ase an vncouth pilegrim : he &yogh;eode up and doun,
he ne seide neiþer on ne oþur : bote bi-heold þane toun.
In þe temple was a fals god : a maumet luþur i-nov&yogh;,
Þare-inne was þe feond of helle : and muche folk to him drov&yogh;—
¶ huy cleopeden þat Maumet Astaroth. : þat þoru&yogh; þe deoueles mi&yogh;te
Ofte he wolde Answerie men : and manie[MS. nanie] he bi-nam heom heore si&yogh;te,
heore speche and heore limes al-so : and dude[MS. duden] men wo i-nov&yogh;;
& &yogh;wane he a-&yogh;en ani sick man cam[om. cam] : of his vuele he[r. him] with-drou&yogh;,
Þanne was þe sike man hol anon : ase he moste nede a-mende
&YOGH;wane he ne hadde non oþur vuel : bote ase þe schrewe him sende;
And he with-drov&yogh; him of is vuel : he moste nede hol beo.
Þe schrewe tolde þe men þanne : þat þis wonder mi&yogh;ten i-seo,
Þat he hadde þoru&yogh; is mi&yogh;te : þe men i-maud hol i-nov&yogh;—
And þei[r. Al-þei?] þe schrewe ne dude non oþur guod : bote of is vuele him with-drou&yogh;.
Þare-fore sike men al dai : ful þicke a-boute him sou&yogh;te
And criden on him wel deolfulliche : þat he to hele heom brou&yogh;te.
¶ Of þingue þat was al-so for-to come : men axeden him feor and neor
And he heom tolde of alle þing : þoru&yogh; þe deoueles pouwer;
Folk cam þicke a-bouten him : bi dai&yogh;e and bi ni&yogh;te,
And he ansuerede heom of al þat huy wolden— : muche is þe deoueles mi&yogh;te!
Ake after þat seint Bartelmev : to þulke cite com,
Þe power of þat false god : clanliche he bi-nom:
For he ne mi&yogh;te aftur þulke tyme : with[al. for] no man speke ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t
Ne &yogh;iuen Ansuere of no-þing : so he was bi-neoþe i-brou&yogh;t;
Þat folk cam þicke a-boute him : to witen at him heore wille
Of þingues, ase huy weren bi-fore i-woned : and euere he was puyr stille.
Þare-fore was wonder inov&yogh; : deol and sor al-so,
huy weren a-ferd to beon for-lore : and þat huy hadden ou&yogh;t misdo:
to atoun huy wenden þare-bi-side : þoru&yogh; heore alre wit,
to an oþur Maumet þat was his felawe : þat huy cleopeden berit;
huy crieden on him wel deolfulliche : þat he heom tolde fore
&YOGH;wi Astaroth, heore owene god : his speche hadde for-lore.
"&YOGH;e, &yogh;e," seide þis luþere best : "&yogh;e ne witen nou&yogh;t hou it is?
with strongue chaines al fuyrie : he is i-bounde, i-wis,
For Bartelmev, godes seriaunt : þat is þudere i-come
And in þe cite geth wel stilledeliche : and[al. om.] is power him hath bi-nome
And i-bounde him so faste þat he ne may : enes drawe is breth,
Ake þoru&yogh; Anguische is clene ouer-come : ase þei he hadde i-þoled deth."
¶ "&YOGH;wat is [he] þilke Bartelmeu&yogh;" : þeos oþere him axeden a-non,
"Þat mai makien ore almi&yogh;tie god : ded so any ston?"
"he is," seide þis Maumat : "of gret pouwer, ase &yogh;e i-seoth,
he mai do with us al þat he wole : for bi-neothþe him we beoth.
Eche daie an hundret siþe : and oþur swuch bi ni&yogh;te
he knevleth to is god in guode entente : þat &yogh;ifth him al is mi&yogh;te;
Aungles with him i-nowe he hath : &yogh;ware-þoru&yogh; þat he may do
Al þat he wole with us alle : and alle þing he wot al-so—
For he wot nouþe þare ase he is : al ore speche and ore þou&yogh;t.
Þare-fore ich rede eov alle wel : þat &yogh;e ne wrathþi him nou&yogh;t.
ech-manere speche þat is : he knoweth and speket al-so,
bote at one worde, alle þing : he wot &yogh;wat is i-do.
&YOGH;if &yogh;e him sechez, þei &yogh;e come : ri&yogh;t bi him ase he is,
&YOGH;e ne schulle him nou&yogh;t i-seo : bote him-seolf wolle, i-wis.
Ake þus &yogh;e him mouwe i-knowe : &yogh;if &yogh;e him i-seo :
he is swiþe long of bodi : of ri&yogh;t fair fourme and freo,
Opri&yogh;t he geoth and euene i-nov&yogh; : and swiþe &yogh;wij&yogh;t is his bleo,
his her is broun and swiþe crips : non ne mai cripsore beo,
Muchele ey&yogh;ene and euene nose : i-strei&yogh;t a-doun a-long,
his berd is long and sid i-nou&yogh; : and sum-del hor a-mong;
In a &yogh;wij&yogh;t Golioun he geth : he nath cloþes non mo—
Alle þis sixe-and-twenti &yogh;er : þar-inne he hath i-go
Þat fram him it neuer-eft ne cam : ne hit ne a-peirez nou&yogh;t of hewe
Ne for-oldeth nou&yogh;t with-alle : ake is euere i-liche newe.
Wel he wot al þat &yogh;e spekez : and &yogh;wat &yogh;e doth alle here;
Þare-fore, &yogh;if he eou axeth ou&yogh;t : &yogh;e ne mowen eou nou&yogh;t skere.
Ake &yogh;if he him sewi[al. schewe] so : þat &yogh;e him mowe i-seo,
biddez him for his louerdes loue : þat he beo milde to me,
Þat he ne come nou&yogh;t here nei&yogh; me : þat ich beo to grounde i-brou&yogh;t
And i-tormented ase mi felawe is— : for i-nelle mis-don him nou&yogh;t."
¶ Þo þis fole men þis i-heorden : huy weren in gret þou&yogh;t,
And longue heom þou&yogh;te are huy hadden : seint Bartelmev&yogh; i-sou&yogh;t.
huy wende a&yogh;en to heore owene temple : ake huy weren alle blinde :
twei dai&yogh;es huy sou&yogh;ten him faste : and ne mi&yogh;ten him nou&yogh;were i-finde.
A dai ase al þat folk : to þe temple was i-brou&yogh;t,
for-to honouri heore false god : þat ne mi&yogh;te heom helpe nou&yogh;t,
A guydi man þare cam al-so : þat þe deuel hadde i-beo longue
In him and bi-nomen him is wit : and i-tormented him ful strongue.
A-non so þis gidie man : in-to þis temple cam,
Þe deuel þat in him was : gret deol to him nam,
wel loude he gradde, "seint Bartelmeu&yogh; : ich bi-seche þe,
Þine oresones brennez me al : þou haue merci of me!"
¶ Þis holie man stod þare-bi-side : and answerede him a-non :
"beo doumb!" he seide, "ich þe rede : þat þou out of him gon."
Þe deuel fleu&yogh; a-non with þat word : out of him in þulke place,
And þe sike man[al. om.] bi-cam hol and sound : a-non þoru&yogh; godes grace.
Þat folk stod al in gret wonder : þo huy i-sei&yogh;en þis cas,
And bi-heolden þene holie man : þat of swuch power was,
And tolden wide þis holie dede : þat ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t beo i-hud.
In þusse manere seint Barthelmev&yogh; : was formest in Inde i-kud.
Pollimius hiet þe kyng : þat of þulke contreie was :
Sone þe tiþingues to him comen : of þat faire cas.
he hadde ane dou&yogh;ter þat was lunatyke : þat þe deuel hadde muche with to done
And made hire witles[al. biwit] euerech monthþe : ase hit feol in þe stat of þe mone.
he sente to þis holie man : seint Barthelmev&yogh; wel sone,
Þat he of is dou&yogh;ter hadde reouþe : and hele hire þoru&yogh; is bone.
Þudere wende þis holie man : and þis mayde founde
Bitinde alle þat nei&yogh; hire come : and grenninde, faste i-bounde.
Þis holie man stod and bi-heold : þene deuel he made out wiende;
hire ri&yogh;te wit heo hadde a-non : euer-eft to hire liues ende.
Welle, glad was hire fader þo : and elles it were with wou&yogh;.
he liet fette forth riche cloþus : and gold and seluer inou&yogh;,
And liet chargi Camailes þare-with : and with riche &yogh;imstones al-so,
to presenti with þis holie man : þat swuch dede hadde i-do.
Ake þare nas non þat mi&yogh;te him finde : þo huy comen with al þis pruyte—
Þare-bi he mi&yogh;ten onder-stonde : þat he þar-of tolde luyte.
And þo no man ne mi&yogh;te him finde : hit of-þou&yogh;te sore þe kyngue.
Ake nathþeles þis holie man : ne for-&yogh;at him of none þingue.
A ni&yogh;t ase he lai in his bed : and on him faste þou&yogh;te,
Þis holie man stod him bi-fore : he nuste ho him þudere brou&yogh;te;
"Sire king," he seide, "&yogh;wat was þe : to siende me swuch pruyte?
Þov ne paidest me ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t þare-with : for ich tolde þar-of luyte;
Ake þat tresor þat ich of telle : þat is heouene riche,
Þat ne roustez ne a-peirez nou&yogh;t : ake euere worthþ i-liche.
And forto techen eov of godes lawe : hidere ich am i-come,
And makie eov leten eouwer false godes : and lieuen on godes sone;[v. 121-2 al. om.]
For-to techen eov þulke lawe : hidere ich am i-brou&yogh;t,
And maken eov leten ouwer false godes : þat ne mouwen eov helpe nou&yogh;t.
And &yogh;if þou nelt nou&yogh;t of þusse þingue : i-lieue þat hit soth beo,
Cum with me to ouwer false god : and þov schalt þe soþe i-seo."
Þe king wende þo forth with him : to hore false god a-non.
heore luþere preostes huy founden þere : bi-fore him mani on
And duden to him heore sacrefise : ase huy weren i-woned to done.
Þe deuel þat wit-inne him was : wel loude he gradde sone,
And seide, "&yogh;e wrechches, leteth a-non : and ne Anourieth me ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t,
laste &yogh;e beon in swuch torment : ase ich am inne, i-brou&yogh;t!
For Iesu cristes Aungeles : þat þe giwes to deþe brou&yogh;te,
here beoth faste a-boute me : and bringueth me al-to nou&yogh;te;
with brenninde raketei&yogh;es : huy habbeth me faste i-bounde,
Þoru&yogh; power of heore hei&yogh;e louerd : þat þe giwes &yogh;euen deþes wounde
And he þare-aftur þane þridde day : so weilawei þe stounde,
Fram deþe to liue he a-ros : and brou&yogh;te us alle to grounde,
And in eche side his apostles sende : to prechie godes name,
And on of heom is nouþe here : þoru&yogh; &yogh;wam ich habbe þis schame."
¶ Þat folk stod and bi-heold a-boute : and nusten &yogh;wuch he was.
Seint Barthelmev&yogh; stod and si&yogh;te sore : and ofte seide alas,
And seide, "nouþe &yogh;e mouwen i-seo : &yogh;wuch lijf &yogh;e ledeth her,
And in &yogh;wuch a god &yogh;e bi-lieueth : and &yogh;wuch is his pouwer!
&YOGH;if &yogh;e wollez þat ich bidde for eov : mine louerd þat us bou&yogh;te,
Draweth a-doun ouwer Maumat : ant to-brekez him al-to nou&yogh;te!"
Þo þe king i-heorde þis : his men he hiet ech-on
A-bouten him casten strongue ropes : and drawen him a-doun a-non.
Þat folk was þo redi a-non : and ropes casten on him i-nowe.
Ake huy ne mi&yogh;ten him nou&yogh;t enes wawie : for al þat huy alle drowe.
"Doth a-wei," quath seint Barthelmev : "and ouwer ropes nimez a-doun!"
And þo þe schrewe on-bounde was : seint Barthelmev&yogh; seide is oresoun :
"Þou deuel," he seide, "þat hast bi-traid : þus muche folk ech-on,
&YOGH;if þou wolt þat I-ne make þe nou&yogh;t : to þe putte of helle gon,
wiend out a-non mid[al. of] þulke fourme : and brec hit al-to nou&yogh;te!"
Þe deuel a-non with þulke worde : wel narewe is wei he sou&yogh;te,
And to-bruysde al þat wrechche maumat : and wiende[MS. wiend þe] out þarof a-non;
And alle þe maumates of þe temple : heo to-daschten euerech-on.
Al þat folk stod and þis i-sei&yogh; : and wel loude bi-gonne to crie,
And seiden, "þare nis bote on al-mi&yogh;ti god : i-boren of þe mayde marie!"
Seint Barthelmeu criede on Iesu crist : and bad is oresoun.
An Aungel cam so bri&yogh;t so sonne : fram heouene li&yogh;te a-doun,
to þe four huyrnes he fleu&yogh; a-boute : and in euereche he drou&yogh;
with his finger a wel fair croiz : apert and cler inou&yogh;.
"Mi louerd," he seide, "me sende hidere : and ase he him-seolf me sede,
Þis temple i-chulle bi-fore eou alle : clansi of eche fuylþe-hede.
Ake ichulle nouþe formest þene deuel : to eov alle schewen, i-wis,
Þat &yogh;e mouwen þe soþe i-sco : &yogh;wuch ouwer bi-leue is.
Ake þei he beo grislich for-to bi-holde : ne habbez of him no doute,
Ake swuch signe ase ich habbe i-maud : in þeos four huyrnes a-boute,
Makiez þulke sulue signe : in ouwer fore-heued ech-on,
And ech luþur þing euereft schal : fram eou fleon oþur gon."
Þo maden huy alle in heore fore-heued : þe fourme of þe rode;
And þe Aungel heom scheuwede al a-brod : þene deuel ase huy stode,
Þe fourme of a grislich man : þat al for-broide were
And swarttore þane euere ani blou&yogh;man : with foule farinde chere;
A scharp face he hadde and al for-kroked : his berd atelich and long,
Ei&yogh;ene brode al brenninde : red and swart a-mong;
A-non to is fiet tilde is her : and after þe schrewe sum it drou&yogh;;
his hondene bi-hinden him at his rug— : huy weren þare wel i-nou&yogh;!
Fuyrie speldene al stinkende : out of is mouth he blaste,
And fuyr of brumston at his nose : þat stonk al-so foule and faste;
Croked was boþe nose and mouth : wrechchede was his bone—
And bote it[al. þis] were and[r. ane] hendi bacheler : a-bid for-to eft-sone!
Daiþet habbe swuch a louerding : and alle þat him wel loue!
&YOGH;eot, þei þe schrewe gret pouwer habbe : god is euere a-boue.
¶ "Þou luþere þing," quath þis Aungel : "þat here art nouþe onder me,
For þou dudest Barthelmeus heste : ichulle habbe reuþe of þe :
Ichulle þe onbinde, and late þe fleo : on eorþe in eche ende,
For-to þe dai of dame[r. dome] come : þat þou to helle i-wiende."
Þo þis luþere best onbounde was : with wel grisliche bere
he fleu&yogh; a-wei a-mong heom alle : and neuereft ne cam þere.
Þo þe Aungel hadde al þis ido : to heouene[MS. heouene heuene] he wende an hei&yogh;.
&YOGH;eorne criede ech of heom : þat al þis wonder i-sei&yogh;,
And hereden god, and þene Aungel al-so : þat þare a-mong heo[m] cam;
huy crieden euere on seint Barthelmev : þat he &yogh;eue heom cristindom.
So þat al þat ilke lond : to cristine-dom was i-brou&yogh;t þo,
Þoru&yogh; þe Aungele and seint barthelmev— : i-blessede beon huy bo![v. 197-8 al. om.]
Pollimius with is Quene : alle is childrene he nam
And liet heom[on the margin.] baptizen of seint barthelmev&yogh; : and sethþe al is kinedom;
So þat al þat ilke lond : to cristinedom was i-brou&yogh;t.
Þe king for-sok al is lond : and ne tolde þarof ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t,
And wende and siwede seint Barthelmeu&yogh; : and prechede with him wel faste,
And bi-cam swiþe holi man : and was bischop at þe laste.
¶ Ane broþer, herre kyng þane he was : he hadde, of grete pruyte,
Astriages was is name : þare-bi-side a luyte.
Þe tyþingue of seint Barthelmeu&yogh; : wel sone to him cam,
Al-hou he hadde þene king is broþer : i-turned to cristinedam :
A þousend men wel j-Armede : After him he sende
For-to enqueri in-to al þat lond : &yogh;woder-ward he wende.
huy wenden and sou&yogh;ten him ful stuyrneliche : and þo he was i-founde,
bi-fore heore kingue Astriages : huy brou&yogh;ten him, faste i-bounde,
And swiþe ofte he was with heom i-pult : þat he feol a-doun to grounde.[v. 213 al. om.]
¶ "Bel ami," seide Astriages þe king : "hou hauest þou on i-take?
hast þou mine broþur with tricherie : i-maked mi godes for-sake,
bi þe fei þat i schal to mahun : ichulle serui þe al-so
And make þe bi-leue þine false god : oþur to strongue deþe þe do.
And &yogh;eot, þeof, more schame opon oþur : ase ich i-heore[ich iheore al. om.] bi mannes sawe,
Þov hast ore godes elles-&yogh;ware : defoulet and al-to-drawe."
¶ "Sire king," quath seint Barthelmeu&yogh; : "þou ne seist nou&yogh;t as þe hiende,
Þat i scholde with tricherie : þine broþeres heorte wiende;
with no tricherie ne wende ich him : ake with sothþenesse and with ri&yogh;te,
Ich brou&yogh;te him out of mis-bi-leue : to him þat [hath][om.] alle mi&yogh;te,
Fram þe godes þat beoth al-so mi&yogh;te-lese : ase is þat dede treo
Þat ich liet al-to-drawe. : and &yogh;if þou wolt þe soþe i-seo,
bring me to þine oþur god : and &yogh;if ich mai don swuch dede,
I-lief wel þat he is mi&yogh;teles : and for-sak þou him, ich rede.
And with þulke god þat ich on bi-lieue : &yogh;if þou mi&yogh;t so on take,
Ich rede þat þou a-cordi þe : and þine owene god for-sake;[al. Ich þe bihote truliche : þat ich him wole forsake.]
And &yogh;if þat ich mai þoru strencþe of mi louerd : þinne god ouer-come,
For-sak þe wrechches ase huy beoth wuyrþe : for heore mi&yogh;te heom is bi-nome."
Nadde he bote þis word i-seid : þat þare ne cam to þe kingue
A messager wel hasteliche : þat brou&yogh;te him ful sori tiþingue :
Þat berit is owene god : þat he wel ofte sou&yogh;te,
was i-falle of þe temple a-doun : and al to-dascht to nou&yogh;te.
¶ Þo þe king i-heorde þis : sori he was i-nou&yogh;,
he fierde ase a man þat witles were : and is cloþes al to-drou&yogh;.
he liet nime seint barthelmeu : and tormenti him wel faste
And with grete staues legge on him : þe &yogh;wyle huy wolden i-laste.
Þo he was defoulet so : þat reouþe it was to wite,
Ase we findez in some stude : of his liue i-write,
¶ He liet him don on a rode : is heued toward þe grounde,
Fiet and hondene to þe treo : i-nailled and faste[al. oþer] i-bounde;
And seth, to don him more pine : ase we findez i-w[r]ite al-so,
Þo he hadde þeron i-honged longue : he liet him a-doun do
And liet huylden is fel al fram is flechs : al quik with kene knyue;
Ri&yogh;t ase men huyldeth a ded oxe : men hulden him a-liue.
Alas, hou mi&yogh;ten huy habben þe heorte? : alas, þe deolfulle pine!
louerd, muche is þi mi&yogh;te : ase þov scheoudest þare bi þine hine!
Atþe laste þo he was i-huld : ase we findez i-writen al-so,
huy smiten of is holie heued : are huy mi&yogh;ten him to deþe do—
Vnneþe huy mi&yogh;ten mid al þis wo : bringue is lijf to fine.
Muche wonder was þat ani lijf mi&yogh;te : on eorþe þolie swuch pine![v. 252-3 al. om.]
his bodi was þoru&yogh; cristine men : i-bured faire i-nou&yogh;.
Wel þicke, ase huy dorsten : þat folk þudere-ward drou&yogh; :
For ore louerd anon-ri&yogh;t for is loue : fair miracle þare sende;
&YOGH;ware-fore guode men þare-a-boute : wel þicke þudere wende.
¶ Þe luþere king Astriages : þat him liet so a-quelle,
he dradde him sumdel of þe miracles : þo he heorde þar-of telle :
Þane þreotteoþe dai þare-afterward : þat he liet him martri þere,
Alle þe grete maistres he nam with him : þat of þe temple were,
And to is toumbe huy wenden alle : þare ase þat holie bodi lai.
Anon so huy þudere comen : ase al þat folk i-say,
Þe deuel, þat heore maister was : tormentede heom a-non :
For wreche of þat holie man : huy bi-comen guydie ech-on,[MS. æchon]
And ase for-lorene wrechches huy deiden þo : he ne liet heom no leng gon;
Into helle þe soulene with him he nam : þare ne liet he nou&yogh;t on.
¶ Þe tyþingue was sone wide i-brou&yogh;t. : huy dradden heom wel sore
Þat of mis-bi-leue weren : huy ne dorsten þo non-more,
Ake huy for-soken hore false lawe : and beden ore louerdes ore,
And lieten heom cristni euerech-one : þoru&yogh; seint Barthelmeus lore.
POllonius, þat kyng was er : and þat to ore louerdes lawe him nam,
bischop huy maden him ouer heom alle : to holden op cristin|dom.
he was bischop twenti &yogh;er : are he dude heonne i-wiende;
to þe Ioye of heouene is soule wende : atþe twenti &yogh;eres ende.[v. 276-311 om. in Ashm. & Vern.]—
Þare was of seint Barthelmeu&yogh; : Miracles euere i-nowe,
And wel þicke al-a-boute to is toumbe : muche folk euere drowe.
&YOGH;eot þare weren luþere men bi-leued : and hadden þa[r]to envie,
Þat he bi-liefden nou&yogh;t þat ore louerd was i-bore : of þe maidene Marie :
A veteles huy maden al of led : and þare-inne huy caste
Þis holi bodi wel fijlliche : and dutten it swyþe faste,
And amidde þe se casten hit : and wolden deliueren heom so.
Ake &yogh;eot ore louerd cudde is mi&yogh;te : ase he hath ofte i-do :
For þat ilke led a-&yogh;ein is kuynde : þei it vuele were is ri&yogh;te,
Aboue þe watere it gan to fleote— : þare was godes mi&yogh;te!—
For þat watur nadde power non : to holden it to þe grounde.
to þe cite of lupar it flet : and þare it was furst i-founde,
And of cristine men op I-nome : and faire on eorþe i-brou&yogh;t.
&YOGH;eot ore louerd, þei he were þare : he ne for-&yogh;at him ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t :
For he sende miracles riuedeliche : a-boute þe bodie þere.
Atþe laste some luþere men : þat in þe londe were
hadden þar-to &yogh;eot gret onde : and in a tyme bi-stelen þare-to
And nomen þe bones up fram þe stude : þat huy weren inne i-do,
And in þe contreie a-boute heom bere : and casten euerech in his side,
Some in one stude and some in oþur : and to-spradden heom so wel wide,
For huy ne scholden neuereft to-gadere come : ne more miracle do.
So[al. om.] longue, ase godes wille was : defoulede huy weren so.
SEint Barthelmeu&yogh; cam sethþe : to a monek þare-bi-side :
"Mine bones," he seide, "beoth i-cast : and al-to-spradde wel wide :
I-nelle non-more þat huy beon so : þare-fore þou most gon
Þis ny&yogh;t a-boute þare huy beoth : and to-gadere heom bringue ech-on."
"A, sire, merci," þis Monek seide : "hou scholde ich i-knowe heom nov?"
"Swiþe wel," seide þis holie man : "and ichulle þe tellen hou :
Euerech of heom þare huy liggez : þei it deork ni&yogh;t beo,
Schyne schullen ase bri&yogh;te ase sonne : þat wel feor þou schalt heom i-seo."
¶ Þis Monek wende forth bi ni&yogh;te : he ne fond of heom nou&yogh;t on
Þat huy ne schinen ase clere ase ani sonne. : and so he gaderede heom ech-on.
In a schip he brou&yogh;te heom in þe se : with gret honour at-þenende,
Þat &yogh;wodere-so ore louerd wolde : þoru&yogh; is wille [he] heom sende.
A wynd þare cam and drof þat schip : softe and euene i-nou&yogh;;
So þat to þe londe of a-puyle : þat schip wel euene drou&yogh;.
Þare weren þe bones faire onder-fongue : and faire in schrine i-do.
Mani fair Miracle þare comen sone : And &yogh;eot þare doth al-so.
Bidde we nouþe seint Barthelmev&yogh; : þat hei&yogh; Apostle is,
Þat we moten þoru&yogh; his bone : come to heouene blis. AmeN!
